DPR Akan Klarifikasi Fachrul Razi Soal Celana Cingkrang dan Cadar
07 Nov 2019, 03:51 by Dewi Nurita, Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komisi VIII DPR RI akan memanggil Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi pada hari ini, Kamis, 7 November 2019. Selain rapat kerja membahas evaluasi program dan anggaran Tahun 2019 serta rencana program Tahun 2020, dalam pertemuan ini, DPR juga meminta klarifikasi Fachrul Razi terkait pernyataannya tentang larangan cadar dan celana cingkrang di institusi pemerintahan.
"Walaupun Menteri Agama sudah menyatakan bahwa persoalan cadar dan cingkrang ini sudah dianggap selesai, tapi saya kira publik patut mengetahui tentang apa yang ada dalam pandangan menteri agama terkait dengan rencana kebijakan tersebut," ujar Wakil Ketua Komisi VIII, Ace Hasan Syadzily di Kompleks Parlemen, Senayan pada Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Ace mengatakan, DPR mengkritik pernyataan-pernyataan kontroversial mantan Wakil Panglima TNI tersebut karena dianggap meresahkan publik. "Harusnya Menag menyampaikan hal-hal yang mendamaikan publik, bukan membuat resah," ujar Ace.
Dua hari yang lalu, Fachrul Razi telah meminta maaf atas pernyataannya terkait cadar dan celana cingkrang yang menimbulkan kontroversi dan kritik, belakangan ini. Ia merasa sebetulnya tak ada yang salah, namun ia menduga pernyataan itu terlalu dini. Fachrul juga menegaskan bahwa aturan ini hanya akan berlaku di lingkungan Kementerian Agama.
“Kalau itu menimbulkan beberapa gesekan-gesekan ya mohon maaf. Rasa-rasanya enggak ada yang salah rasanya. Mungkin saya mengangkatnya agak terlalu cepat,” kata Fachrul dalam pertemuan perkenalan dengan Komisi VIII DPR, di Hotel Sultan, Jakarta, Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Fachrul mengatakan ia sebenarnya hanya ingin meramaikan diskusi terkait radikalisme. Bukan hanya soal celana cingkrang dan cadar namun juga hal lain seperti khilafah. Sehingga bisa menjadi semacam sosialisasi saat nanti aturannya terbit. “Sehingga gaungnya sudah duluan kita buat sehingga pada saat muncul aturan mudah-mudahan orang tak berkejut lagi,” kata dia.

DPR Will Clarify Fachrul Razi on Cingkrang and Veil Pants
Nov 7 2019, 03:51 by Dewi Nurita, Juli Hantoro
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Commission VIII of the Indonesian House of Representatives will summon Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi today, Thursday, November 7, 2019. In addition to the work meeting discussing the evaluation of the 2019 program and budget and the 2020 program plan, in this meeting, the DPR also requested clarification Fachrul Razi related to his statement about the prohibition of veils and trousers in government institutions.
"Even though the Minister of Religion has stated that the veil and cingkrang problem is considered over, but I think the public should know about what is in the view of the minister of religion related to the policy plan," said Deputy Chairman of Commission VIII, Ace Hasan Syadzily at the Parliament Complex, Senayan on Thursday, November 7, 2019.
Ace said, the House of Representatives criticized the controversial statements of the former Deputy Commander of the TNI because they were considered disturbing the public. "The Minister of Religion should convey things that reconcile the public, not make them uneasy," Ace said.
Two days ago, Fachrul Razi has apologized for his statement regarding the veil and trousers that have caused controversy and criticism, lately. He felt there was actually nothing wrong, but he suspected the statement was too early. Fachrul also emphasized that this regulation would only apply to the Ministry of Religion.
"If that causes some friction, sorry, sorry. I feel nothing wrong. Maybe I picked it up a bit too fast, "Fachrul said in an introductory meeting with the House of Representatives Commission VIII, at the Sultan Hotel, Jakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Fachrul said he actually just wanted to enliven the discussion related to radicalism. It is not only a matter of trousers and veils, but also other things like the khilafah. So that it can become a kind of socialization when the rules are published. "So we made the echo first so that when the rule arises, hopefully people will not be surprised anymore," he said.
